newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Souza Cruz started.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Souza Cruz started.

text.p: -- Fonte Cindam investment bank said it is starting coverage of Brazilian cigarette maker Cia Souza Cruz S.A. with a neutral rating.
-- The bank said Souza Cruz, which controls 83 percent of the local cigarette market, is an efficient, well-run firm but posted lower-than-expected sales revenue in the year's first half.
-- "The price rose but sales fell more than people expected," said bank analyst Roberto Veirano. "They now must grow via exports."
-- The bank is projecting a net profit of $212 million this year and $218 million both next year and in 1998. The firm posted net income of $198 million in 1995.

-- The bank said the firm plans to increase its share of the export market, boosting sales revenue, through an ambitious program calling for $650 million in investments by 2000, which will reduce costs.
-- However, the bank is unable to determine what impact the program will have due to the scarcity of information being released by the company.
-- Souza Cruz's voting common share was off 0.23 reais at 6.22 reais at 1504 local/1304 EDT on the Sao Paulo bolsa.
